runs.comm: tossed up angled across, Dilshan pushes into the off side
pulls the length back a bit, Dilshan makes room chops it between cover and point for a single
length ball, straightening slightly on leg, Kusal goes back and turns it behind square on the leg side, plenty of time for a second as Dernbach fumbles
flatter length ball outside off, pushed back to the bowler
tossed up a little more, Kusal pushes at it a bit early and it goes in the air, but falls well short of the bowler
length ball straightening on middle, Kusal clips it toward midwicket and takes a single
length on the stumps, Kusal just defends to leg as the bottom hand comes through

gone! Kusal looks like he feels he didn't hit it, but there was a definite deflection on first viewing. This is a short ball outside leg stump - one that should have been put away really, but Perera goes for the pull too late and seems to have got glove on it, on the way to the keeper.

another one goes! Or does he? Full ball shaping away, Jayawardene gets a thick leading edge as he plays at it, and the ball loops to cover, but Lumb has to dive forward full stretch to intercept it before it hits the turf. He collects the ball and claims the catch immediately, but Mahela stands his ground, as he feels it might have bounced. Replays are not totally conclusive, but I'm about 75% sure he's caught that cleanly. But it's given not out. Broad is annoyed, somewhat understandably.
length on the legs, ball stays in the pitch and Mahela just bunts it towards the leg side
short of a length outside off, Mahela deadbats this as well
poor ball, waist-high on the body. Mahela swivel pulls this nicely and gets it fine of fine leg for four.

dilscoop first ball to Bresnan. Dilshan's not in great form, but maybe this is how he can reclaim it. It's a length ball on off stump, Dilshan goes down on one knee and sends it over the fine leg rope. Love watching that.
tries the dilscoop again. The length is there, but the line is not. It's too far outside off stump and moving away slightly, Dilshan doesn't connect
short of a length just outside off stump, Dilshan punches straight to point
short of a length outside off again, Dilshan stands tall and pushes it to short cover
another Dilscoop attempt, another miss. That ball was full and wide - a candidate for the Dilshan cover-drive, but he goes for the wrong shot
length just outside off, hit back to the bowler. Six off the first ball, nothing off the rest.

full on middle stump, it stops a bit but Mahela is all over that one. He chips this beautifully over midwicket, accounting for the swing away from him and everything. It's into a big space on the leg side and dribbles away for four
and there's where you want to bowl to Mahela, early in his innings. This is back of a length, about eight inches outside off. Mahela pokes at it and misses
HO! lovely hands from Mahela. That's short and at Mahela's chest, he just backs away and ramps this over slip, and through third man for four. An error on the boundary helps him out.
length ball outside off, Mahela pokes again, misses again
length just outside off stump, Mahela makes room and tries to blast this through cover point, but is nowhere near the ball. Cry of anguish from Mahela, who seems annoyed for missing out.
length on middle stump, Mahela just gets into line and drops this into the legside infield, which is spread wide enough to allow a run
short of a length ball over the stumps, Mahela runs at him and tries to get it away on the off side again but misses

top-edge, but he's got plenty on that, so it sails high over the boundary. This is short on the body, Mahela saw fine leg was square so he got inside the line and swivel pulls it. This is miles over the fence
oh dear Jade Dernbach! Mahela top-edges another one, this is high, heading straight to mid on Dernbach sets himself under it, gets his fingers pointing up and promptly shells it
Mahela's rubbing salt in it, if unintentionally. This is length on the stumps, Mahela makes room again and french cuts it past the keeper for four
short of a length wide of off stump, really zipping off the surface, Mahela tries to cut and misses
short of a length, quick off the pitch and into the body, as Mahela backs away. Hits him on the arm guard I think
a little short on off stump, Dilshan heaves at it but doesn't time it. Short midwicket stops the ball.
short on middle stump, Dilshan plays an extravagant aerial pull, and again, doesn't time it. But he gets it over the infield to Moeen Ali at fine leg
delicious flick from Mahela. Boy he is great to watch even when he's missing half his shots. This is full and on the toes, he just clips that through square leg all along the turf for four
short of a length, backs away again and misses
full and on the pads, Mahela tries to clip it away to leg, but it hits his pad and deflects toward short third man. They take a run.
full outside off stump, Dilshan plays the booming cover drive, gets a thick inside edge past the stumps, and takes a single
tossed up, angled across Dilshan, who gets it down to long-off off a leading edge
tossed up on the pads, turned to vacant midwicket for a single
tossed up again, Dilshan comes down the pitch and whacks it straight, but the bowler gets a hand to it. Still gets down to long on
wide ball outside off, Mahela dabs at it but misses
full on the stumps, paddle swept behind square off a bottom edge
tossed up on middle stump, no turn, Dilshan drives this straight past the stumps, and Moeen Ali can't get around fast enough from long off to prevent a couple
full outside off stump, Mahela drives hard at it, but can't get it past cover. Slight misfield allows one.
Hey Oh! That's middled for sure. Length on middle stump, Dilshan goes with a big backlift and swings that high over midwicket for six. Great shot.
short on the stumps, Dilshan pulls and is back to not middling it. It goes to deep square leg off the under edge
good bouncer, and that might hit Dilshan in the helmet as he missed his hook. But he doesn't seem concerned.
full on off stump, punched straight to cover

oh dear, England. What is happening? That is dropped again, on the square leg fence. Short ball, Dilshan pulls, doesn't get it high enough and it's seemingly straight to Bresnan, but he shells it. Wet ball or no, there's no excuse
length on leg stump, pushed back to the bowler
fuller and flatter, on middle, pushed back to Tredwell again
full toss on the stumps, driven to long on
length ball wide of off stump, Mahela gets low and late cuts it, but can't beat backward point. Enough time for a single though
full, fired in outside off stump, Dilshan drives that back to the bowler
flat and wide, chopped away square to the off side sweeper
low full toss on off stump, Dilshan clears the front leg and flays it past cover, but doesn't time it well enough to beat the sweeper
shortish, outside off stump, this is slogged away on the on side between long on and deep midwicket. Ugly shot, but it's rarely pretty stuff from Dilshan. A heave that paid off.
full ball on the stumps, turned away into that vacant legside infield. Dilshan wants two at first, but turns Mahela back late. He has to dive to beat the throw from the deep
full on off stump, Mahela gets low and cuts this late, but it's straight to short third man, who can't collect cleanly
yorker about a foot outside off stump, Dilshan chops down on it but misses
low full toss on off stump, Dilshan whips it powerfully to deep midwicket. It's hit too well to allow two
full on the legs, Dilshan comes down the track and drives to long on

lovely shot. He took a moment to read the field before the ball, and when Tredwell tossed it up on leg, Mahela was down the pitch to slam it powerfully between long on and deep midwicket. Superb placement.
and this is what Mahela can do against spin. Tredwell is full on the stumps, Mahela gets low and sweeps it nicely behind square for another boundary

oh another mistake in the field. Mahela is a lucky man. he cut this behind square on the off side and called for two, but it's a very tight second. The throw comes in, but Buttler can't break the stumps on his first attempt, it could have had Mahela short.
full ball, worked away on the off side
full outside off stump, Dilshan strokes this down to long off
full and wide, Dilshan throws his bat at it but gets it straight to cover
yorker just outside off stump, Dilshan makes room and chops down but misses

top edged off a short ball, this goes high, but it falls right in between the keeper going back and fine leg running in. Neither fielder really committed to the catch though, and Borad is not happy! Would have been a tough catch for either man, but they didn't really even attempt it.
full toss on the stumps, driven to long on

finally gets that back-away shot right, does Mahela. That was short over the stumps, Mahela makes room and cuts it behind backward point. Third man runs around and does brilliantly to stop it from going to the boundary. That man had been pushed back to the fence after the previous ball
bouncer at the head, Mahela hooks it half-heartedly and gets a slight top edge. Dernbach runs in from fine leg, but it bounces well in front of him

length ball on leg stump, and Mahela busts out the reverse-sweep for the first time, doesn't connect all that well, but it goes way over the offside fielders and dribbles to the fence. That's his fifty.
down the pitch to a fullish ball outside leg again, carved aerially through extra cover. The sweeper cleans up
yorker, fired in. Dilshan just digs it out
flat and full, Dislhan comes down the pitch and strokes it past the stumps. Long off cleans up
tossed up on the stumps, Mahela is down the track  again, driving aerially through extra cover. Moeen Ali runs around from long off, but it's an easy couple

ho! You felt this shot was coming. Mahela is looking to really turn it on. He's down the track again, Tredwell pulls the length back, but it doesn't matter. Mahela gets underneath this one, which is outside leg stump, and lofts it languidly over wide long on for a sizeable six. He's warmed nicely to the big shots now.
low full toss on the stumps, whipped away by Dilshan to to deep midwicket. That's the century stand. SL's sixth in T20 cricket overall.
short of a length outside off stump, Mahela tried to late cut it but was a little early into the shot. Hits it aerially towards backward point, but it falls about a metre in front
yorker on the toes, clipped away to fine leg

that's a poor ball with this field, you've got to say. It was a slowish bouncer, outside off stump. Mahela climbs into a lovely aerial cut that goes high over the square infield on the off side, a couple of bounces to the fence

and now the other side of the field. This is overpitched on about off stump. Mahela shuffles towards off, gets under it and plays the pick up shot to get it to the cow corner rope on the full. It lands right on the advertising triangle.
fullish ball on the stumps, pushed away to the infield for a single

Mahela backs away but Dernbach follows him, with a high full toss. Mahela works that off his hips to fine leg, and it's actually called no ball for height, Broad not happy - fair enough too. That looked thigh-high
Mahela backs away to this back of the hand slower ball, and gets it between backward point and short third man for one
thigh high full toss again, but outside off stump. Dilshan's trying to slam this away to off, but gets a thick inside edge that evades the stumps. Fine leg has work to do, so it's a couple
Dilshan backs away now, and Dernbach follows the batsman again. This hits Dilshan on the pad, as he tries to whip it through midwicket. Dribbles away toward short fine leg for a single

that's probably my favourite shot of the night. That's almost a yorker, but somehow Mahela gets his hands through that, and times the pants off it to get it past extra cover, and then beats the offside sweeper running around. Lovely shot, played deliciously late,

what is happening out there? That's another dropped catch, from Bresnan again! It's a full toss outside off stump, Mahela carves this over the off side to the sweeper, who has only a few metres to go to complete the catch. It comes to him at a good height. He sets himself and then lets it through his fingers. How many lives is Mahela on here? I've lost count!
yorker about a foot outside off, Jayawardene tries to delicately deflect that through third man, but ends up just jamming down on it
full and wide. Too wide. About a foot outside the guideline
wide full ball Dilhan throws his hands at it and gets a thick outside edge that flies through vacant slip for a boundary. England on the end of some rotten luck so far.

high full toss outside off stump. Dilshan tries to slam that on the off side, but gets an under edge that squirts out square on the leg side. That's called a no ball on height and it's enough for the umpires to want to change the ball
full, slower one outside off stump. Mahela tries to get that to third man, but misses
full, wide and slow. Mahela aims a cover drive and misses again.
length on off stump, Mahela makes room and chops this away behind square on the off side for a single

full outside off stump, Dilshan throws his hands again and gets under it. Again it's not brilliantly timed, but it's high over extra cover and it slides off the greasy outfield to the fence. That's his fifty.
bouncer, but that's too short. It's called a wide on height. Way over Dilshan's head.
short of a length outside off stump. Dilshan tries to upper cut and misses
fullish ball, Mahela backs away and Jordan follows him, but Mahela has still made enough room to get it over the infield, inside out. Bresnan at offside sweeper runs around and cuts it off nicely
lovely shot. Moves from leg to off this time. Jordan goes full and straight, Mahela gets low and scoops this over the shoulder, well away from the short fine leg for four
overpitched outside off stump, Mahela makes room again to try and crash this square on the off side but misses the shot. Batsman is annoyed with himself for missing out

gone! England get him finally. This is fullish and on the stumps, Mahela tries to slog that away on the legside with the angle, but he misses again, and the ball crashes into leg stump. The end of an equally impressive and fortuitous innings. There were some great shots between the catching chances.
bouncer to start, but this is down leg side and is called wide.
Thisara thrashes at a short of a length ball that's angled across him, and clean misses.

short of a length again, on the stumps this time. Thisara slogs across the line again, and gets some bat on it. It lands in between the long on and deep midwicket fielders, who run around to keep it to two
dilscoop again! Nasser Hussain predicts this on commentary. Dernbach bowls a length slower ball, Dislhan gets low and scoops it over Buttler for a boundary.

England have held on to one, and it's Jordan at deep midwicket. Slower ball, over pitched, and Dilshan tries to wallop that over midwicket for six. Not timing the ball has been the story of his innings though, and this one is no different. Jordan settles under it about 10 metres from the fence and pouches it near his chest.
full on the legs, Thisara clips this behind square on the leg side, far enough away from the deep square leg to get a couple.
slower ball, wide of Thisara, and he gets nicely under this one to carve it over cover. The offside is all in the ring, so that's not a great line from Dernbach. Skips away on the wet turf for four
short of a length ball outside off stump, Thisara heaves at it but misses
yorker, but outside leg stump. Thisara goes to back away but gets out of the way in time to prevent contact. That's a wide.
that's a Thisara special. He loves that shot. It's a slower length, ball on the stumps. Thisara clears that front pad and swings it high over midwicket for six.

full ball on off stump. Sanga clears his front leg and tries to bash that straight down the ground as well, but mistimes it terribly and just lobs it up in the air for wide mid off to get under it. Probably wasn't the man for the occasion, it has to be said.
full and outside off stump, Thisara clears the leg again and plays an identical shot to Sanga, but he doesn't time it at all, thankfully for him. It goes on the first bounce to mid off.
short of a length at the body, Mathews backs away and chops this to point for a single.
overpitched, wide on off stump. Thisara slaps it, but it's straight to cover. Will feel he should have got more from that ball, which was a poor one.
thigh high full toss, Perera swings it to the deep square leg fielder, and that's just one run. Another poor ball that could have gone for more.
low full toss outside off stump, Mathews punches this to deep cover - just one again. With that run, SL have now made the highest score at this venue.
low full toss outside off stump, Mathews muscles this away to long on
low full toss on off stump, Perera slogs that hard and flat straight to Bopara at wide long on, but wouldn't you believe it, it's dropped again!
short of a length outside off stump, and though Thisara tries to bash this to leg again, he gets a top edge which flies high over short third man, and all the way to the fence
yorker on the stumps, squirted out to deep midwicket. Good ball.
slightly overpitched on the stumps, but Mathews can't get under it as he wanted. Still whipped away on the leg side between deep square leg and deep midwicket. A couple there.

bam! Lovely finish from Mathews, who you've got to say, has been on point with his finishing for about two months now. Bresnan misses his length, and has overpitched that on the stumps again. Mathews stands tall and plays that lovely legside pick-up shot, sending it high over deep midwicket. Mathews doesn't bother running. The legside fielders don't bother even following the ball. That's way back in the stands.
